title: Maoist killed in encounter with police in Chhattisgarh’s Sukma
content: The exchange of fire started on a forested hill under Errabor police station limits when a team of security personnel was out on an anti-Maoist operation

title: Kerala local body polls: Fierce three-cornered battle on the cards in Varkala
content: In the 2025 local body elections, the BJP will be pushing for supremacy and the LDF careful not to lose its weakened grip on the municipality. On its part, the UDF will seek to recover lost ground, but it continues to be troubled by internal issues

title: Kerala local body polls: Congress attempts to brush aside the Bihar election blues
content: Though the poll outcome of Bihar may not have any direct bearing on the Congress and its allies in the State, the electoral debacle has left a dampening effect on the enthusiasm of the party workers.

title: Delhi car blast case: ED conducts searches at Faridabad’s Al-Falah University, linked persons
content: The chairman, Javed Ahmad, has been issued two summons to appear before the Delhi Police, a source told The Hindu

title: Protests over Shivaji bust removal from Pune govt office; reinstated amid uproar
content: The protesting outfits opposed the removal of the bust, claiming it had been part of a heritage structure

title: Odisha’s popular singer Humane Sagar dies at 36; CM Majhi, BJD’s Naveen Patnaik convey condolences
content: The Odia singer was diagnosed with bilateral pneumonia, acute on chronic liver failure (ACLF), multi-organ dysfunction syndrome and other complications

title: The trajectory of anti-rape laws in India | Explained
content: By condemning the 1979 Supreme Court acquittal in a custodial rape case, Chief Justice of India B. R. Gavai has highlighted India’s evolving legal reforms aimed at better protecting sexual assault survivors and redefining consent

title: Tamil Nadu rains: Cuddalore, Villupuram districts declare holiday for schools
content: Holiday declared for schools and colleges in Puducherry, Karaikal; ‘yellow’ alert for eight T.N. districts

title: Iran suspends visa waiver for Indians after ‘misuse by criminal elements’; MEA issues advisory
content: Visa-free entry ends from November 22, 2025; MEA urges Indian nationals to remain vigilant and avoid agents offering visa-free travel or onward transit to third countries via Iran

title: ITR forms, rules under new Income Tax Act to be notified by January: CBDT chief
content: The intent is to keep the income tax return (ITR) forms simple for taxpayers to ease compliance, he said

title: Chennai’s Museum of Possibilities shows what inclusive living can look like
content: Located on the State Commissionerate for Differently Abled campus on Marina Beach Road, MoP is a demonstration centre for assistive technology for people with disabilities

title: IIT Madras-Indian Railways jointly launch Omics Translational Research Lab
content: A press release stated that the lab would facilitate research on early diagnosis, disease prognosis, biomarker discovery, and drug screening across a spectrum of diseases

title: Environmental groups oppose Centre’s move to exempt WTE plants from Environment Impact Assessment
content: In its notification, the MoEFCC said solid-waste management systems play an important role in protecting environmental and human health, advancing the circular economy, and reducing air, land and water pollution.

title: Need for being vigilant against online fraud, cybercrimes stressed
content: Deputy Commissioner Divya Prabhu says it is required especially in the wake of increasing instances of online and financial fraud

title: Show cause notices issued to 196 medical shops after Statewide inspection drive uncovers violations
content: The inspections were carried out to identify irregularities in retail pharmacy practices, particularly concerning the sale of Schedule H1 medicines such as higher-generation antibiotics and habit-forming drugs

title: V. Srinivas takes charge as Rajasthan Chief Secretary
content: Along with the Chief Secretary’s post, Mr. Srinivas will hold the additional charge of chairman of the Rajasthan State Mines and Minerals Limited and the State’s Principal Resident Commissioner in New Delhi

title: India to submit updated climate targets to U.N. by December end: Bhupender Yadav
content: As a signatory to the Paris Agreement, it is a requirement that India issue an updated NDC in 2025, which spells out its voluntary actions towards transitioning away from using fossil fuel and improving energy efficiency use

title: MGL expects restoration of gas supply by November 18
content: The damage to the main gas supply pipeline of GAIL occurred at the RCF premises, Trombay, and also affected the gas supply at MGL’s City Gate Station (CGS) at Wadala since Sunday (November 16, 2025), MGL said

title: West Bengal school recruitment scam: ‘Tainted’ candidates have made it to the fresh interview list, allege teachers
content: Fresh protests erupted in Kolkata ahead of the interview as many ‘untainted’ teachers who lost their jobs after the Supreme Court order cry foul

title: School children move Delhi HC seeking rescheduling of outdoor sports to months with safer air quality
content: The petition states that the children, who actively participate in zonal, inter-zonal, state and national sporting activities, are being forced to engage in strenuous physical exertion in “a highly toxic environment”

title: Delhi CM targets Punjab over stubble burning; air quality continues to be ‘very poor’
content: The Delhi CMO said that Ms. Gupta said that states like Haryana, Rajasthan, and Uttar Pradesh have shown positive progress in crop-residue management in recent years, but the volume of smoke coming from Punjab remains significantly high

title: In 2024-25, India remained leading place of origin of international students in U.S.: Report
content: The U.S. State Department sponsored report showed that total international students in U.S. went up by 5% in 2024-24, and new enrolments went down by about 7%

title: Madhya Pradesh government revokes land pooling scheme for permanent Kumbh city in Ujjain amid farmers’ protest
content: The decision to repeal the scheme comes amid protests from various farmer organisations and before a major agitation in Ujjain on Tuesday (November 18, 2025); the Bharatiya Kisan Sangh has called back the agitation

title: More women enrol in defence and strategic studies course in University of Madras over the past few years
content: The course offers an array of topics that shapes the students’ strategic thought on national security and offers subjects including specialised warfare, conflict resolution, arms control and disarmament, and fundamentals of national security

title: State sees 5.25 lakh dog bite cases and 28 rabies deaths so far this year
content: In view of the rise in cases of dog bites — from 4.8 lakh last year — the Director of Public Health and Preventive Medicine says the issue has to be tackled with inter-departmental coordination

title: T.N. Council of Historical Research invites applications for fellowship
content: The fellowship entails conducting in-depth and exhaustive research on the history of Tamil Nadu extracted from archival records in the State

title: In ‘unusual intervention’, SC forbids grant of bail to accused in digital arrest case
content: Justice Surya Kant said such cases of deception of senior citizens deserve “unusual orders”. “We have to deal with these cases sternly so that the right message is sent,” he said

title: ‘Indian Muslims no longer fear SIR, did not fall in Mamata’s trap’: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari
content: Trinamool Congress spokesperson retorts saying that the people of West Bengal are severely disgruntled with SIR; AI likely to be used to scan duplicacies in electoral roll, sources in CEO’s office say

title: India, Russia looking at finalising new pacts, initiatives during Putin's visit to New Delhi
content: As part of the preparations for the visit, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday, November 17, held extensive talks in Moscow with his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov.

title: Poll petition: M. Swaraj withdraws appeal before SC
content: Mr. Swaraj had earlier approached the Kerala High Court, alleging that his rival candidate had canvassed votes on religious grounds

title: Delhi blast culprits will get strictest punishment: Amit Shah
content: Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, eliminating terrorism from its roots is our collective commitment, says Shah at Northern Zonal Council meet

title: Father of accused Kulgam youth succumbs to injuries
content: The victim, a dry fruit seller by profession, was also detained for questioning by the police a few days ago, locals said

title: Cashew scam: Kerala HC slams State govt for denying nod for CBI probe
content: The High Court asked if the government’s stance on combating corruption was undermined by its protection of those facing serious allegations.

title: ‘We’ll engage with all stakeholders’ in Bangladesh, says India after Sheikh Hasina verdict
content: “India has noted the verdict announced by the Tribunal concerning former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. As a close neighbour, India remains committed to the best interests of the people of Bangladesh,” the Ministry of External Affairs says

title: 27 lakh MGNREGS deletions an attempt to deny rural poor right to work: Congress
content: Jairam Ramesh cites The Hindu report on deletion of 27 lakh MNREGS workers in a month and calls it another step towards dismantling the scheme

title: RJD reviews results; Tejashwi made Legislature Party leader
content: The party meeting to review the debacle in the Assembly election included discussions on the anger of local leaders who were dropped, and mistakes in ticket distribution and the selection of candidates

title: Telangana to join nationwide anti-drug pledge as Excise dept. highlights major seizures over 5 years
content: State government has instructed schools, colleges, women’s groups, anganwadi workers and Auxiliary Nurse Midwives across Telangana to administer the pledge simultaneously at 11.30 a.m.

title: Kerala to observe World AMR Awareness Week
content: Bid to improve awareness and understanding of antimicrobial resistance and encourage best practices among the public

title: Political parties question handling of seized explosives by J&K police
content: The accidental explosion inside the Nowgam police station in Srinagar on the night of November 14 left nine dead and 32 injured

title: India-China ties improving, says Army Chief
content: The Army Chief said Operation Sindoor was “just a trailer that ended in 88 hours”. “If Pakistan gives a chance, we will teach it how to behave responsibly with a neighbouring nation,” said Gen. Dwivedi

title: Arrested Pune engineer preached anti-democracy ideology: Maharashtra ATS
content: Zubair had links with terror group al-Qaeda, and was preaching to youth that “democracy is against Shariat” and created content on topics, including Jihad and “Ghazwa-e-Hind”, the takeover of Indian subcontinent by a Caliphate

title: Centre reviewing Supreme Court ruling on forest laws and tribal housing, says Minister
content: Tribal Affairs Minister Jual Oram said “we need to ensure that flagship programmes like PM-JANMAN and DAJGUA continue to serve our tribal communities effectively”

title: Kuki-Zo MLAs say no decision taken about joining popular government in Manipur
content: The statement came after a section of media, on Monday (November 17, 2025) reported that all the 10 Kuki-Zo MLAs have decided to join a popular government in place of the existing President's rule

title: Incessant rains may bring India’s coffee output down by 30,000 tonnes: KPA
content: Over 2,000 coffee growers in Karnataka’s Kodagu, Hassan and Chikmagaluru may have an estimated loan outstanding of ₹400 crore to ₹500 crore

title: Reconsider location of 184-feet high Lord Murugan statue, Madras High Court tells Marudhamalai temple management
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar & D. Bharatha Chakravarthy say, the stress that could be caused to the ecology due to proximity to reserve forests must be taken into account

title: No rain in A.P. despite orange alert for Nellore, Tirupati
content: IMD expects light to moderate rain in SCAP and Rayalaseema over the next four days; fresh low-pressure area likely over southeast Bay of Bengal on November 22

title: Stray dog menace leaves walkers worried
content: Full-fledged infrastructure, proper vaccination of dogs, consistent ABC, resources and manpower are needed to control dog population, say experts

title: RPF nabs four ‘Haryana Gang’ members who stole jewellery worth ₹50 lakh in a coordinated operation
content: The accused who had stolen the valuables on Chennai-Mangaluru Mail in Kerala, were caught on Mangaluru-Mumbai Matsyagandha Express at Madgaon

title: Va. Tech hires Franklin; PSU buyout renegotiated
content: Virginia Tech hired James Franklin to be its next football coach. The former Penn State coach was originally owed a $49 million buyout after being fired, but part of his deal with the Hokies includes a $9 million settlement from PSU, sources told ESPN.

title: Bengals' Chase suspended one game for spitting
content: Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase has been suspended one game without pay for spitting on Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey.

title: Sources: Spurs' Wembanyama out for a few weeks
content: Victor Wembanyama, who had an MRI on Sunday, will be sidelined for a few weeks as the Spurs are being cautious about his left calf strain, sources told ESPN.

title: Man charged with murder in shooting of Beam
content: A 27-year-old man was charged Monday with murder in the death of celebrated former football coach John Beam.

title: Giannis set for MRI after exiting with groin strain
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo left in the second quarter of Monday's loss to the Cavaliers because of a left groin strain.

title: Skaggs' mom: Angels never asked about addiction
content: Debbie Hetman, the mother of Tyler Skaggs, said she didn't know whether her son informed the Angels of his drug addiction but added that she was never asked.

title: Source: Sanders' home broken into during debut
content: There was a break-in at the home of Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders during Sunday's game against the Ravens, a source confirmed to ESPN on Monday.

title: WC ticket holders can get priority visa interviews
content: FIFA World Cup ticket holders will be able to receive prioritized visa interviews before arriving in the United States for the tournament.

title: Fixing the Mavs: Why there's no cure-all for this Dallas disaster
content: Can this mess be fixed? Our NBA insiders are breaking down the Mavs' options amid a tumultuous 4-10 start.

title: The Chiefs aren't broken -- but they could miss the playoffs: Barnwell on what has gone wrong
content: The Chiefs are 5-5 after losing to the Broncos. They're third in the AFC West, and ESPN's FPI has them at 55.4% to make the playoffs. Is it time to worry?

title: Connelly's 25 favorite games: How they went down and what they mean
content: From A&M's historic comeback to heart-stoppers at all levels, Week 12 was packed with games to remember.

title: NFL offensive coordinators and playcallers: What has gone right and wrong for all 32 teams
content: NFL Nation reporters break down the good and bad for each OC/playcaller and peg the key to success the rest of the season.

title: Players react to efforts to halt team report cards: 'Pushback shows it's working'
content: NFL players who spoke to ESPN say the report cards are making a tangible impact on workplace conditions.

title: A weekend with the banana suits and shirtless fans surviving Oklahoma State
content: It has been a bad year for the Pokes. It hasn't stopped their fans from making their own bright spots.

title: Grading bold season predictions for all 30 MLB teams
content: It's time to see if what we said about each club going into the season was accurate or not -- and what it means for 2026.

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 11: MVP for Josh Allen? Sack record for Myles Garrett?
content: Is Allen a prime MVP candidate again? Has the AFC West torch been passed? We overreact to Week 11, plus fantasy football takes.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll Week 2 reaction: What to know about every team
content: The second in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what next for every team in the standings.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: The second in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Cena makes final 'Raw' appearance: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: Cam Skattebo, Abdul Carter and Giants scuffle ringside with Judgement Day at 'Raw'
content: The New York Giants took matters into their own hands -- or fists -- when Judgement Day called them out.

title: Paul vs. Joshua: Everything you need to know
content: How did the fight come together? What does this fight mean for Paul, Joshua? Andreas Hale answers this questions and more.

title: The NHL's best this week: How the Devils move forward minus Jack Hughes
content: One of the game's elite players will be out eight weeks for a division leader. Plus, a look at the week's key games.

title: Buzz: Week 11 was a rough one for many superstars
content: Week 11 brought opportunities for top fantasy options, but it also saw many disappointing performances.

title: 2026 World Cup: Germany, Netherlands book their places
content: The race to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is drawing to a close. Here's how it's looking around the globe.

title: How Norway sealed first World Cup spot since 1998
content: With the likes of Erling Haaland and Martin Ødegaard, Norway are ready to make an impact on the big stage.

title: UFC 322 fight grades: Shevchenko, Makhachev were good but boring
content: Back-to-back-to-back knockouts gave the UFC 322 main card life, but the title bouts cooled things off.

title: Early bets for Week 12: Bears to cover at home, Saints to pull off upset among plays
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are five early bets to consider going into Week 12.

title: Draymond Green reflects on being on receiving end of Wemby alley-oop slam
content: Though the play didn't count, Victor Wembanyama's dunk over Draymond Green on Friday quickly became a viral moment.

title: Why a 1990s Isuzu Trooper was a meaningful 30th birthday gift for Karl-Anthony Towns
content: The New York Knicks star's girlfriend went out of her way to revive a priceless memory for his 30th birthday.

title: How five-star Austin Goosby fits at Texas, more 2026 commitment projections
content: Breaking down top class of 2026 commitments, including the five-star who stayed in-state to play for Texas.

title: Man United's plan: Save millions in wages, rebuild midfield
content: Next summer looms as a busy transfer period for Manchester United: More than £1 million in wages will be offloaded, which will in turn free up space for some major midfield upgrades.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Pulisic will wait until signing new Milan contract
content: Will Christian Pulisic continue his club career at AC Milan? Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Trump Administration Sues California Over Law Banning Masked Federal Agents
content: The Trump administration filed a lawsuit Monday over California's new laws banning federal agents from wearing masks and requiring them to have identification while conducting operations in the state.

title: "I Don't Believe In Death Penalty": Shashi Tharoor On Sheikh Hasina Verdict
content: Sheikh Hasina was on Monday sentenced to death in absentia by a special tribunal in Bangladesh for "crimes against humanity".

title: "Muhammad Yunus Wants Civil War": Sheikh Hasina's Aide After Death Penalty Verdict
content: The Awami League has slammed the Mohammed Yunus-led interim government in Bangladesh over "staged drama" in what they called a "kangaroo court", after the ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and one of her close aides were sentenced to death.

title: Trump Unveils "FIFA Visas" For 2026 World Cup Ticket Holders
content: President Donald Trump on Monday unveiled special fast-track visas for people with tickets to the 2026 World Cup -- but his administration warned it was no guarantee of entry to the United States.

title: "I Will Deal With It": Lalu Yadav's First Reaction On Family Feud
content: Lalu Yadav's children, Tejashwi Yadav and Rohini Acharya, reportedly had a fight after the RJD faced a humiliating loss in the 2025 Bihar assembly election.

title: 'Ask An Astrologer': DK Shivakumar On Karnataka Leadership Change Query
content: "What is wrong with having aspirations?" was Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar's response when asked about several Congress legislators openly expressing their desire to be included in the state cabinet.

title: 'Parasocial' Crowned Cambridge Dictionary Word Of 2025: What It Means
content: Do you feel a deep bond with pop stars like Taylor Swift or Lily Allen -- even though you've never met them? If you do, then your behaviour is "parasocial" and bang on trend according to the Cambridge Dictionary

title: Trump Lauds UN Security Council Vote For His Gaza Peace Plan
content: US President Donald Trump hailed the UN Security Council's vote Monday in favor of his Gaza peace plan, claiming it would lead to "further Peace all over the World."

title: Madhya Pradesh Men Kill Nephew After Heated Fight Over Bihar Poll Result
content: An argument triggered by political discussions over the Bihar poll verdict resulted in the killing of a 22-year-old man allegedly by his maternal uncles in Guna district of Madhya Pradesh, police said on Monday.

title: Far-Right Candidate Jose Antonio Kast Leads Chile's Presidential Race
content: Chilean candidate Jose Antonio Kast is favored by analysts to win the country's presidency in a runoff next month, a sign of how his far-right anti-immigrant views have gained a wave of new support amid fears about increased crime.

title: 39-Year-Old Labourer Beaten To Death By Colleague In Mumbai: Cops
content: A 39-year-old worker hailing from Gujarat was beaten to death allegedly by his colleague at a private steel company in south Mumbai in the wee hours of Monday, police said.

title: Judicial Activism Should Not Turn Into "Judicial Terrorism": Chief Justice
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai on Monday said that judicial activism should not turn into "judicial adventurism or judicial terrorism".

title: Venezuela Woman, 65, Jailed For 30 Years For Criticising Maduro In WhatsApp Message
content: A Venezuelan court has sentenced a doctor to 30 years in prison for criticizing Nicolas Maduro's government in a WhatsApp audio message, rights groups told AFP on Monday.

title: Trump Says US Will Sell F-35 Fighter Jets To Saudi Arabia
content: President Donald Trump said Monday he will sell F-35 fighter jets to Saudi Arabia as he praised the kingdom for its strong partnership with the United States.

title: US, Saudi Arabia To Sign Civil Nuclear Framework: Report
content: The United States will sign the framework of a civil nuclear cooperation agreement with Saudi Arabia during a visit by its crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman, a person familiar with the negotiations said Monday.

title: US Imposes Visa Restrictions On Nicaragua Over Immigration
content: The United States is imposing visa restrictions on people in Nicaragua who have enabled illegal immigration to the country, the State Department said on Monday, including the owners of transportation companies, travel agencies and tour operators.

title: Trump Says Will Talk To Venezuela's Maduro Amid Growing Tensions
content: President Donald Trump said Monday he will talk to Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro as Washington's military buildup stokes tensions, and added that he would be "OK" with US anti-drug strikes inside Mexico.

title: Hamas Rejects UN Gaza Resolution, Says It Doesn't Meet Palestinians' Rights
content: Gaza's Hamas rulers said they rejected Monday's UN resolution which calls for an international force to be deployed in the territory, saying it fails to respect the "demands and rights" of the Palestinians.

title: "Window Is Closing": Pope Calls For Concrete Actions On Climate Change
content: Pope Leo XIV on Monday urged "concrete actions" on climate change and complained that some leaders lacked the will to act, as he addressed religious dignitaries on the sidelines of the COP30 summit.

title: 'White collar terror module': ED raids Al-Falah University; searches at 25 locations in Delhi-NCR
content: A central agency raided Al-Falah University in Faridabad as part of the Delhi blast case investigation. This action follows the arrest of the university chancellor's brother and scrutiny of the institution due to its former student being the prime accused. Delhi Police have summoned the chancellor to address inconsistencies and clarify roles of individuals linked to the university.

title: 'Endured what happened to me but ... ': Tej Pratap slams 'insult' to sister Rohini
content: In a passionate outburst, Tej Pratap Yadav took aim at family members and RJD associates whom he branded as 'betrayers' for disrespecting his sister, Rohini Acharya. This vehement reaction came on the heels of Rohini's retirement from the political arena and ongoing family turmoil.

title: 45 dead in Saudi: Two relatives from each Telangana family to be flown to Riyadh
content: A devastating bus crash in Saudi Arabia claimed 45 Indian lives, with one survivor recounting the harrowing event. The Telangana government is coordinating relief efforts, offering ex gratia payments and arranging for families to travel to Saudi Arabia for funeral rites. Investigations into the accident are underway, highlighting the country's high road fatality rate.

title: '14 ke ho, kaise maarte ho ye chakke?': Oman players puzzled by Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: India's 14-year-old batting prodigy Vaibhav Suryavanshi has captivated young Oman cricketers Samay Shrivastava and Aryan Bisht with his explosive six-hitting prowess.  Suryavanshi's record-breaking 144 against UAE and 45 against Pakistan Shaheens have left the duo eager to meet him.  Both Shrivastava and Bisht share fascinating journeys from India to representing Oman.

title: Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death: Dhaka reiterates extradition call; India non-committal
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was sentenced to death in absentia for the 2024 student crackdown, a verdict she called a foregone conclusion. India responded cautiously, acknowledging the verdict and reiterating its commitment to Bangladesh's peace and stability, while remaining non-committal on extradition requests.

title: China’s top chipmaker warns slowdown: Demand weak across electronics, autos; firms ‘hesitant..'
content: China's top chipmaker, SMIC, warns that AI's demand for advanced memory chips is causing customers to delay orders for other components.  This shift, driven by high prices for AI-specific memory, could lead to shortages and price hikes for everyday electronics and vehicles next year, impacting global supply chains.

title: 'Am I Harmanpreet?': Bangladesh captain denies assault claims
content: Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty vehemently denied allegations of physically assaulting junior players, calling them baseless. She questioned why complaints would go to a former player residing abroad. Sultana controversially invoked Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur's past on-field outburst, asking if she would behave similarly. The captain asserted her innocence, stating she has never harmed a teammate.

title: SSC revises disability certificate formats to simplify recruitment process
content: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has revised Disability Certificate formats for its examinations, following DEPwD guidelines. Certificates are now classified as Form V (Single Disability) and Form VI (Multiple Disabilities), replacing the earlier three forms. Candidates for exams notified after October 16, 2024, may use either old or new formats, ensuring a streamlined, transparent, and inclusive recruitment process.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 250 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was below 25,950, BSE Sensex dropped over 250 points.

title: Google's rare milestone: First-ever ‘appreciation note’ in 25 yrs; from world’s biggest investor
content: Berkshire Hathaway has made its first-ever $4.3 billion investment in Google-parent Alphabet, a move analysts attribute to a leadership transition and Alphabet's strong financial profile. This significant purchase, alongside a reduction in its Apple stake, signals a potential broadening of Berkshire's tech investment strategy under new leadership.

title: 'The future of Pakistan is shining bright': Naqvi in seventh heaven
content: Pakistan Shaheens defeated India A by eight wickets in the Rising Stars Asia Cup, advancing to the semi-finals after a batting collapse by the Indian side.  The Shaheens successfully chased down 136 runs, showcasing a dominant performance. This victory follows the senior team's ODI series sweep against Sri Lanka. PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi expressed his joy.

title: Rs 30,000 crore will: Delhi HC asks Priya Kapur to respond to Karisma Kapoor's children's plea
content: Delhi High Court has asked Sunjay Kapur's wife, Priya Kapur, to respond to a plea by Karisma Kapoor's children. They seek to inspect the original of their late father's alleged Rs 30,000 crore will, which they claim is forged. The children accuse Priya Kapur of fabricating signatures and being greedy, calling her a 'Cinderella stepmother'.

title: Bihar: Tejashwi Yadav offers to step aside; Lalu says he should lead RJD
content: An emotional Tejashwi Prasad Yadav offered to step down as RJD legislative party leader, but was urged by patriarch Lalu Prasad to continue. The party's poor election performance was discussed, with leaders blaming EVMs and demanding a return to ballot papers for future elections.

title: How to send WhatsApp messages without saving a contact on your phone
content: WhatsApp enables users to initiate chats without saving phone numbers, streamlining one-time conversations and business inquiries. This feature, accessible via Click to Chat links or the official "Chat on WhatsApp" button, allows for quick communication and reduces contact list clutter on both mobile and web platforms.

title: WWE RAW highlights Nov 17: Reigns, Lesnar & AJ Lee return; Cena’s final show
content: Madison Square Garden witnessed a monumental RAW featuring Brock Lesnar and Roman Reigns' returns. John Cena's final RAW appearance saw him accept a Survivor Series rematch against Dominik Mysterio. Becky Lynch lost her Intercontinental Championship to Maxxine Dupri after AJ Lee's interference. The show concluded with chaos as Lesnar and Reigns' returns ignited a massive brawl.

title: IND vs SA: Gill's condition remains doubtful; India summon Nitish Kumar Reddy
content: Nitish Kumar Reddy is set to rejoin India's Test squad for the second match against South Africa in Guwahati. He was previously released for India A fixtures to gain game time.

title: 2026 WC: Faster US visas? President Trump unveils 'FIFA Pass' to help travellers
content: The Trump administration has launched "FIFA Pass," a program to expedite visa interviews for international visitors attending the 2026 World Cup. This initiative offers prioritised appointment scheduling for ticket holders who purchased through FIFA, balancing immigration policies with the anticipated influx of travellers. The State Department has deployed additional consular officers to manage the increased applications.

title: Trump’s Gaza peace plan: UNSC approves US-drafted resolution; Hamas rejects proposal
content: The US-led Gaza peace proposal has gained the approval of the UN Security Council, which will now deploy an International Stabilisation Force to manage demilitarization efforts and deliver humanitarian aid. Despite the backing, both Russia and China chose to abstain, while Hamas dismissed the resolution, calling it a violation of their autonomy and an affront to groups resisting outside influence.

title: Top Cardiologist reveals how your arm position can affect Blood Pressure while measuring it
content: According to Dr Levine, proper arm placement is needed for the right blood pressure reading. The American Heart Association, says that one must always make sure the arm is supported, relaxed and at heart level, when taking a blood pressure reading. If the arm is not at heart level or is unsupported, gravity and muscle tension can increase, or decrease the pressure in the arteries, leading to misleading results

title: Rockets tipped to land $118M Mavericks star in blockbuster NBA trade
content: Houston Rockets, surprisingly strong early, are exploring a blockbuster trade for Kyrie Irving to fill the void left by Fred VanVleet's season-ending injury. This move would reunite Irving with Kevin Durant, a partnership that previously generated significant excitement. The proposed deal involves trading VanVleet and Dorian Finney-Smith for Irving, offering Houston a veteran playmaker and elite scorer.

title: Kyrie Irving injury update: Mavericks Star nears key return decision
content: Kyrie Irving is astonishingly bouncing back from his ACL injury, showing signs of rapid recovery ahead of expectations. Whispers around the league indicate he might be hitting the court as early as late January or just in time for the All-Star festivities, with some insiders even suggesting he possesses the skills to compete in the playoffs today.

title: Shedeur Sanders’ debut overshadowed by burglary at his Cleveland home
content: Cleveland Browns rookie Shedeur Sanders experienced a jarring NFL debut as his home was reportedly burglarized during his first game. This incident highlights a disturbing trend of athletes being targeted while playing, with authorities warning of organized crime rings. Sanders now faces personal distress alongside his professional duties as he prepares for future games.

title: Knife attack at Bengaluru airport: Taxi driver assaults rivals
content: A taxi driver was arrested at Kempegowda International Airport for allegedly attacking two other drivers with a knife near Terminal 1. The incident occurred early Monday following a dispute over business. An ASI of CISF intervened and apprehended the suspect, securing the weapon without further harm.

title: France agrees to sell up to 100 fighter jets to Ukraine
content: France has pledged to sell up to 100 Rafale fighter jets and other defense equipment to Ukraine, signaling European resolve to counter long-term Russian threats. This historic agreement, extending to 2035, aims to bolster Ukraine's sovereignty and foster closer defense industry ties between the nations.

title: Explained: Cowboys’ Decision to Bench CeeDee Lamb and George Pickens on MNF
content: Dallas Cowboys' crucial Week 11 game against the Raiders began with confusion as star receivers CeeDee Lamb and George Pickens were surprisingly benched.  This wasn't due to injury, but a coach's disciplinary decision, reportedly for missing team obligations. The offense struggled immediately without them, highlighting their importance for the team's season.

title: India's Test crisis at home - Stats reveal slide as batters struggle on spin tracks
content: India's home Test invincibility is faltering, marked by alarming rapid batting collapses on spin-friendly pitches and a rise in three-day defeats. Despite a strong overall record, recent losses expose vulnerabilities against disciplined spin. The upcoming Guwahati Test, expected to be more batting-friendly, presents a crucial opportunity for India to reset.

title: UP mine: Officials say 8 missing, eyewitnesses claim 15–16 still buried; toll rises to 6
content: Six labourers have died following a stone mine collapse in Sonbhadra, Uttar Pradesh. Rescue operations are ongoing to clear debris and ensure no one else is trapped. Families of the deceased will receive over Rs 20 lakh in financial aid, housing, and education benefits, as authorities continue their efforts.

title: Delhi car blast: Module planned Hamas-style drone strikes; NIA probe uncovers wider plot
content: NIA arrested a second Kashmiri man, Jasir Bilal Wani, in the Red Fort suicide bombing case. The module, linked to Jaish, planned Hamas-style drone attacks and was building small rockets for serial blasts. Wani allegedly provided technical support for these drone modifications and rocket construction, aiming to replicate attacks seen in conflict zones.

title: Delhi car blast case: ATS scans Shaheen & Parvez's foreign links; tracks ties across 3 nations
content: UP ATS is expanding its probe into the foreign travels and overseas associations of Dr. Shaheen Shahid and her brother Dr. Parvez, arrested in a white-collar error module case. Their stays in Saudi Arabia, Maldives, and Turkey are being investigated for potential links to radical networks and monitored individuals.

title: 'Our players don't play domestic cricket': Gavaskar warns Gambhir
content: Sunil Gavaskar has slammed India's batting collapse against South Africa, attributing it to players neglecting domestic cricket. He argued that the absence of Ranji Trophy participation leaves batsmen unprepared for challenging pitches. With Shubman Gill's injury adding to concerns, the team faces immense pressure to perform in the next Test.

title: Kessler twins Alice and Ellen die together at 89, chose assisted euthanasia
content: Legendary German twins Alice and Ellen Kessler, 89, have passed away together through medically assisted dying in Munich. The inseparable sisters, who lived their lives in unison, chose to end them with the same clarity and intention. Known for their post-war European fame, their bond remained strong until the end, with their ashes to be interred in a single urn.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Investors looking for opportunities on November 18, 2025, can consider NBCC and Punjab National Bank, according to Mirae Asset Sharekhan. NBCC shows a breakout and is poised for an uptrend, while PNB is forming a bullish pattern above key moving averages.

title: First-ever in India! Eden Test sees historic low - India, SA bowled out under 200 in all four innings
content: India suffered a rare home defeat at Eden Gardens, losing to South Africa by 30 runs in a low-scoring Test. The match set records for low totals and failed chases, with Shubman Gill missing due to injury. South Africa aims to seal the series in the next Test.

title: Missing for 28 years: SIR scare brings man home; family stunned by reappearance
content: A man missing for 28 years, Jagabandhu Mondal, returned to his village in West Bengal to reclaim his voter identity. Believed dead by his family, he reappeared after losing his job, only to find his name deleted from electoral rolls. His return presents a challenge for authorities to verify his identity and restore his voting status.

title: Marathi actor recalls disturbing local train incident
content: Marathi actress Girija Oak, who is known for her acclaimed performances in Taare Zameen Par, Shor in the City and Jawan, is once again in the spotlight. This time, it’s not for a project but for a look that has gone viral on social media. Fans are calling her the new 'National Crush', stunned by her simplicity, grace and natural charm. Amid this attention, Girija has also opened up about a troubling personal experience from her younger days.

title: 'Precautionary decision': Two SL cricketers return from Pak before tri-series
content: Sri Lanka's T20 tri-series campaign faces a setback as captain Charith Asalanka and fast bowler Asitha Fernando are returning home due to illness. The board termed the move precautionary, ensuring their recovery. Dasun Shanaka will lead the team in Asalanka's absence. Pavan Rathnayake has been added to the T20I squad as a replacement.

title: Hasina death verdict: Son calls ruling 'a joke and meaningless'; political storm grows
content: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death in absentia by a tribunal for "crimes against humanity" over her government's crackdown on a mass uprising. The tribunal accused her of murder, torture, and ordering the use of lethal weapons. Hasina, who fled to India, called the tribunal "rigged" and "politically motivated."

title: Ashes: Bodyline, Bradman, Botham, Stokes - A look at 5 iconic series between Australia and England
content: England and Australia will start the new Ashes series in Perth on Friday, stepping into a rivalry that has carried its own history for more than a century. England arrive with a clear target: to take back the urn for the first time since 2015. The article revisits five memorable series, highlighting iconic moments like Ben Stokes' Headingley heroics in 2019 and England's narrow 2005 victory.

title: Is LaMelo Ball playing vs Raptors tonight? Latest update on Hornets star
content: LaMelo Ball is back for the Charlotte Hornets, injecting much-needed stability and offensive rhythm against the Toronto Raptors. After an ankle injury sidelined him, Ball's return is crucial for the depleted Hornets. His playmaking and leadership are expected to elevate the team's performance and pace, aiming to boost their standing in the Eastern Conference.

title: Delhi car blast probe: Shah vows to track culprits ‘from netherworld’; stresses terror-free India
content: Home Minister Amit Shah vowed to bring perpetrators of the Delhi car bomb blast to justice, emphasizing the government's commitment to eradicating terrorism. Addressing the Northern Zonal Council meeting, he highlighted the importance of inter-state cooperation for national strength and discussed speedy justice for crimes against women and children, including increasing fast-track courts.

title: Chandrayaan-4 mission: Isro locks 2028 target; plans ambitious lunar sample return
content: India's Chandrayaan-4 lunar sample-return mission, a complex joint effort with Japan, is slated for a 2028 launch. This initiative aims to explore lunar resources and develop crucial operational technologies. Concurrently, ISRO is progressing with its manned lunar mission target of 2040 and the Bharatiya Antariksha Station by 2035.

title: Assam roll update: EC orders special revision; opts out of SIR amid NRC concerns
content: The Election Commission has ordered a special revision of Assam's electoral roll for the upcoming assembly polls, with January 1, 2026, as the qualifying date. This mandatory house-to-house verification aims to include all eligible citizens without requiring proof of eligibility. Details of 'doubtful' voters will be carried forward pending tribunal orders.

title: US LPG deal: India inks 2.2m-tonne pact; move aims to cut trade imbalance
content: India's state-run oil companies have secured a one-year deal to import 2.2 million tonnes of cooking gas from the US, marking a significant diversification of its energy sources. This move is expected to help balance trade, a key concern for the US administration, and reduce reliance on traditional Gulf suppliers.

title: Modern classics: 25 of the best kits from the 21st century
content: the 1990s still reign supreme as the decade with the most enduring and sought-after retro football shirts . since the year 2000 we have seen some timeless entries into the jersey hall of fame . as we approach the end of 2025, we've assembled 25 of the best original kits released by top clubs from leagues all over the world .

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .

title: What do Week 11 games mean for the rest of the season?
content: the 49ers beat the Buccaneers 3-0 in the AFC East on friday . quarterback Josh Allen scored three touchdowns for the bills in the afternoon games . a shootout against the 49er and a rushing touchdown from the 49s led by a quarterback .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through start of spring training .

title: 30 teams, seven tiers, one clear title favorite: How the league stacks up
content: the rest of the top five teams in net rating are now the contenders we expect . a bottom tier has separated itself, with fans and executives dreaming of snagging a top prospect . all season long, ESPN's Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton will be sorting the 30 teams into tiers .

title: Free agent pickups: Believe in Brissett to replace your injured QB?
content: the 11th Sunday of the NFL season began with the final international game of the season, as the Miami Dolphins topped the Washington Commanders in Madrid, Spain . much happened in between, including the Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen accounting for six touchdowns, the Arizona Cardinals quarterback Jacoby Brissett breaking the NFL record with 47 completed passes . we await further clarity on which quarterbacks will be available for Week 12 .

title: Antonio Brown's journey from All-Pro to criminal defendant
content: former all-pro wide receiver faces up to 30 years in prison . he pleaded not guilty last week and is scheduled for arraignment Monday . the 37-year-old's attorney and the prosecutor raised doubts about the alleged victim's claim that a bullet fired by Bronx was fired .

title: USC-Oregon, Missouri-Oklahoma and betting lines for every top-25 team
content: "College GameDay" will be making its second visit of the season to Eugene, Oregon . there are only four intraconference matchups, including Kentucky at Vanderbilt , Arkansas against Texas , Tennessee against rival Florida . Notre Dame will welcome ACC opponent Syracuse to South Bend, Indiana .

title: What does Justin Fields' benching mean for the future of the Jets?
content: Aaron Glenn benched quarterback Aaron Rodgers' replacement Justin Fields . the move signals the most likely end to the organization's $30 million gambit after 10 games . it will likely be a high draft pick (in 2026 or 2027) or perhaps a trade for a veteran .

title: Saudi bus inferno: 45 Hyderabad Umrah pilgrims killed; lone survivor recounts escape
content: at least 45 umrah pilgrims from Hyderabad charred in a bus inferno . the 46 passengers were part of a 54-member group that flew from the city to Saudi Arabia . they were to return on Nov 23 after visiting Islam's holiest site .

title: Trade stance: India shrugs off sanction threat; affirms Russia ties driven by needs
content: an official says countries will decide on trade based on their interests . the comments come after a threat of additional levies for trade ties with Russia . a senior official said india and the US are nearing cloning .

content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock.
